We are pleased to inform you that your child will be taking part in Start With Hello Week at their school starting September 21-25, 2020. Start With Hello teaches students in grades PreK – 12, the skills they need to reach out and include those who may be dealing with chronic social isolation and create a culture of inclusion and connectedness within their classroom, school or youth organization. Last year, over 12,000 schools from across the United States participated in the Start With Hello Call To Action week to highlight and spread the power in the message of Start With Hello’s three simple steps:

1. See someone alone
2. Reach out and help
3. Start with Hello

We encourage you to talk to your child during this designated week and ask them to share what they have learned. Not only will this help you learn how to support your child, it also demonstrates to your child that you take this subject seriously and can support them in their actions to create a more connected and inclusive home, classroom, school and community.

The Aransas County ISD Board of Trustees is pleased to announce the appointment of Mrs. Rose Tran as the Interim Superintendent of Schools. Her appointment was unanimously approved in a special meeting of the Board of Trustees on September 2, 2020, and is effective September 3, 2020.

Mrs. Tran, a RFHS graduate, began her career in education over 20 years ago as a teacher. She has worked on both Live Oak Learning Center and Fulton Learning Center campuses as an educator and in leadership roles. Mrs. Tran holds a Master degree in Education and a Superintendent Certificate.

The Board of Trustees would like to Thank Mrs. Tran for helping during this transitional time while we actively start the Superintendent search. The Board of Trustees will be working with a search firm to find the best person for this important role. A new Superintendent will be named at the conclusion of our search process.

The Board of trustees would like to sincerely thank Mr. Patek for his dedication to ACISD.

It's College/Career Day in ACISD! This week we will highlight Train Conductors and Engineers.

A conductor or guard is a train crew member responsible for operational and safety duties that do not involve actual operation of the train. A freight train conductor reviews schedules and shipping records. The conductor ensures that cargo and weight is distributed evenly along the train, and maintains communication with the train's engineer, traffic control personnel, and other crew members.

An engineer, engine driver, locomotive pilot, motorman, train driver is a person who drives a train. The driver is in charge of, and responsible for driving the engine, as well as the mechanical operation of the train, train speed, and all train handling.

Last night’s train engineer at Minute Maid did not have to drive that far. We are hoping to hear many horn whistles tomorrow night. GO ASTROS!

According to Psychology Today, bullying is a distinctive pattern of harming and humiliating others, specifically those who are in some way smaller, weaker, younger or in any way more vulnerable than the bully. Bullying is not garden-variety aggression; it is a deliberate and repeated attempt to cause harm to others of lesser power. Electronic bullying has become a significant problem in the past decade. The ubiquity of hand-held and other devices affords bullies constant access to their prey, and harassment can often be carried out anonymously.

Visit the following links to learn more about this topic during National Bully Prevention Month.

Parents and Guardians,
All 5th and 8th grade math and reading STAAR scores have been released.

TEA is seeking to speed up the amount of time it takes for families to receive STAAR results for their children. In order to do this, they have moved to an online portal. Paper copies will no longer be sent home unless requested by the parent.

You may access these results by logging in to the Student Portal at www.texasassessment.com. You will need the child’s Unique Access Code located at the bottom lefthand corner of a previous score report.

If you do not know the child’s Unique Student Access Code, click on the “Find My Access Code” button. You will need the child’s first name, Social Security Number or S-number, and the date of birth.

If you cannot access the report after attempting these steps or require a paper copy, please reach out to your campus, and they will work with you to get what you need.

Anita Diebel hosted LOLC Kindergarten Gifted and Talented students, Benjamin Hale and Natan Serna, today at her art studio and gallery located at 111 N. Austin St, Rockport, Texas. Mrs. Diebel and artist Clementina Rivera worked with both students teaching them to use pastels and watercolors, mixing colors and creating a plein air painting. Students have been learning about Pablo Picasso in GT class and Mrs. Diebel presented each student with a Picasso inspired t-shirt in which to paint. The session concluded with students decorating Picasso inspired pig cookies. I am very grateful for the kindness and generosity of these two amazing and talented artists. Thank you both for sharing your talents with such kind and open hearts.
